body_html:
@ezyang What is the minimum driver version required for CUDA 9.1? Mine is 384.111. I did not use the Docker file that you have created. I build a Singularity container and pull the NVIDIA's Docker image for CUDA 9.1. @ruotianluo Here's how I build the Singularity image:

BootStrap: docker
From: nvidia/cuda:9.1-cudnn7-devel-ubuntu16.04

apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
         build-essential \
         make \
         gcc \
         g++ \
         cmake \
         git \
         curl \
         vim \
         ca-certificates \
         python3 \
         python3-pip \
         libjpeg-dev \
         libpng-dev \
         python3-setuptools

pip3 install --upgrade pip
pip3 install -U setuptools
pip3 install scipy \
                  numpy \
                  matplotlib \
                  mkl \
                  mkl-devel \
                  cffi \
                  Pillow
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
python3 setup.py install

body:
@ezyang What is the minimum driver version required for CUDA 9.1? Mine is `384.111`. I did not use the Docker file that you have created. I build a Singularity container and pull the NVIDIA's Docker image for CUDA 9.1. @ruotianluo Here's how I build the Singularity image:

```
BootStrap: docker
From: nvidia/cuda:9.1-cudnn7-devel-ubuntu16.04

apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
         build-essential \
         make \
         gcc \
         g++ \
         cmake \
         git \
         curl \
         vim \
         ca-certificates \
         python3 \
         python3-pip \
         libjpeg-dev \
         libpng-dev \
         python3-setuptools

pip3 install --upgrade pip
pip3 install -U setuptools
pip3 install scipy \
                  numpy \
                  matplotlib \
                  mkl \
                  mkl-devel \
                  cffi \
                  Pillow
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
python3 setup.py install
```
